post_text:
ATTENTION AMS PARENTS!

All students will begin the school year starting August 5th. Students who have elected the on-campus program will begin the year learning remotely and will be returning to school on August 17th per Governor Ducey's executive order.
text:
ATTENTION AMS PARENTS!

All students will begin the school year starting August 5th. Students who have elected the on-campus program will begin the year learning remotely and will be returning to school on August 17th per Governor Ducey's executive order.

post_text:
Hi AMS Families! Governor Doucey has announced that the start date for schools has been pushed to August 17th. We are gathering more information regarding our online program which will resume as previously scheduled. In the meantime please continue to make your enrollment elections based on what you would like for your children for the first semester of school.

Hola familias de AMS! Gobernador Doucey anuncio que la fecha de inicio de las escuelas se demora hasta el 17 de agosto. text:
Hi AMS Families! Governor Doucey has announced that the start date for schools has been pushed to August 17th. We are gathering more information regarding our online program which will resume as previously scheduled. In the meantime please continue to make your enrollment elections based on what you would like for your children for the first semester of school.

post_text: Thank you Principal Walker. We agree. "Today, we take one more step forward, together."
shared_text:
Academy of Math and Science - Flower
June 19 at 7:27 AM ¬∑

‚ÄúJuneteenth is not just a date. Juneteenth is a spirit. Juneteenth is a mentality,‚Äù said Steve Williams, President of the National Juneteenth Observance Foundation.

Today, we honor #Juneteenth. We commemorate the moment, more than two years after President Lincoln‚Äôs Emancipation Proclamation, that ‚Äúall slaves are free‚Äù finally rang loud and clear.

Today, we continue our work to build equitable, anti-racist environments and cultures in our schools where scholars and adults can grow and THRIVE. Today, we continue the fight for our scholars, our alumni, and our growing community. Today, we take one more step forward, together.

Today, we continue our work to build equitable, anti-racist environments and cultures in our schools where scholars and adults can grow and THRIVE. Today, we continue the fight for our scholars, our alumni, and our growing community. Today, we take one more step forward, together.

post_text:
We are proud to have our executive leadership in discussions and collaborating with Superintendents across the state, as well as the Governor and State Superintendent of Education, to address the potential challenges of the upcoming year. Our teams are working hard to plan for the upcoming year to provide our families with the best learning environment according to preference and needs of each unique scholar.

We can confidently say we will be opening our schools for families who are wanting to bring students back to a classroom and we are working through a plan to offer either hybrid or online options.

At AMS the health and safety of our students and faculty is one of our top priorities, but we will not lose sight of our mission to educate students to be the leaders of tomorrow. We will keep our AMS families informed with news and updates on Facebook, class Dojo and in newsletters.
text:

At AMS the health and safety of our students and faculty is one of our top priorities, but we will not lose sight of our mission to educate students to be the leaders of tomorrow. We will keep our AMS families informed with news and updates on Facebook, class Dojo and in newsletters.

post_text: We love our AMS Teachers!
shared_text:
Curtis Walker‚ÄéAcademy of Math and Science - Flower
May 6 at 5:54 PM ¬∑

Teachers. You are AMAZING. You are RESILIENT. You are INSPIRING. We cannot say enough about your dedication, your drive, your absolute commitment to your scholars. During the craziest time of our lives, you are finding the most inventive ways to stay connected, to keep teaching, and to keep learning going. We appreciate each and every one of you so much. We will be doing everything we can to shine a bright, bright light on your incredible work during this special week. But, it will not tell the full story... Of the moments where you connected with a student in need ‚ù§Ô∏è ... Where all your scholars completed their remote learning assignments on time üöÄ... Where you converted your dining room into a digital classroom üíª From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU. Please join us by thanking your teachers with a video, a story, a note, whatever it may be!

post_text:
AMS Desert Sky asked all their parents to share their love for their teachers! Here is what some parents said about Ms. Amezcua for always striving to reach the top even with the new challenges this year! Thank you for all that you do!

‚ÄúShe is on top of everything! She has great communication with her students and their parents especially during this difficult time we are all going through. To a lot of us parents this can be a little bit overwhelming not knowing how to manage school at home along with a regular job that we still have to attend to. However, Ms. Amezcua has been very helpful and patient in answering our hundreds of questions and sending instructional videos to her kindergartners. The kids feel like they are in a virtual classroom and that helps with making the children feel more at ease. Thank you, Ms. Amezcua, for all that you do!‚Äù

‚ÄúGracias por todo!‚Äù

‚ÄúGracias esta atenta a cualquier problema que tenga‚Äù

post_text: Former NFL Running Back came to AMS Flower to speak to our students about character and choices! Check it out! :)
shared_text:
Academy of Math and Science - Flower
February 21 at 10:07 AM ¬∑

It's not everyday that you have a former NFL Running Back visit your school to talk about his journey to success and the power of choices with students.

Former NFL Running Back, Drew Anderson, who played for both the Denver Broncos and Arizona Cardinals, now spends his time speaking to youth organizations and schools about character and choices. We are extremely excited to have him here today at Academy of Math and Science - Flower!
